meanings.definition: A person who hoards or accumulates things in excess.
meanings.sent1: Some hoarders collect so many items that their homes become very cluttered.
meanings.sent2: The hoarders in the neighborhood had trouble finding space to store all their belongings.
meanings.sent3: The hoarders at the garage sale were excited to add more items to their collection.
meanings.sent4: She was a hoarder of memories, keeping every ticket stub and photograph she ever had.
meanings.sent5: The hoarders in the documentary showcased the extreme nature of their collecting habits.

meanings.definition: To hoard or accumulate things in excess.
meanings.sent1: Some people hoarders food in case of emergencies, stocking up on canned goods.
meanings.sent2: He tends to hoarders old newspapers, unable to throw any away.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel hoarders nuts in preparation for the winter months.
meanings.sent4: She hoarders books like treasures, never wanting to part with any of them.
meanings.sent5: The company hoarders data to ensure they always have enough information for analysis.
